definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: It's my guts sucked into the drain.
sentences.chinese: 是我的肠子给吸进了下水口。

sentences.english: You might accidentally open your mouth to yell and accidentally breathe in some water.
sentences.chinese: 你可能冷不丁地张嘴呼叫，吸进一些水。

sentences.english: The spat grew larger by drawing in seawater from which they derived microscopic particles of food.
sentences.chinese: 贝苗吸进海水中之微小生物作为食物从而越长越大。

sentences.english: Motor nets to prevent the motor inhaling debris.
sentences.chinese: 马达网罩，防止马达吸进杂物。

sentences.english: Breathe in the love instilled into this speck of time and creation.
sentences.chinese: 吸进溶于此时此刻的万物之爱。

sentences.english: The whirlpool sucked down the boat.
The first stroke draws the combustible mixture into the cylinder.
sentences.chinese: 第一行程把可燃混合气吸进气缸。

sentences.english: He drew the first whiff of smoke deep into his lungs and expelled it in a long and lingering exhalation.
sentences.chinese: 他把第一口烟深深地吸进肺以再慢悠悠地吐了出来。

sentences.english: Their gravitational pull is so strong, they absorb light.
sentences.chinese: 黑洞的万有引力很强，能把光线吸进去。

sentences.english: He couldn’t stay at the Lorelei, or he would be sucked into this team of chiselers.
sentences.chinese: 他无法再在罗雷莱停留，他会被吸进这个骗子队伍。

sentences.english: A balloon is mysteriously "sucked" into a flask.
sentences.chinese: 一个气球神秘地被吸进了一个细颈瓶。

sentences.english: Deep belly breathing allows you to take in more air.
sentences.chinese: 腹部深呼吸让你吸进更多的空气。

sentences.english: African elephants hydrate by sucking liquid into their trunk, then pouring it into their mouth.
sentences.chinese: 非洲象把水吸进鼻子，然后在把水灌进嘴里。

sentences.english: These windows seem to suck the dust in.
sentences.chinese: 这些窗子似乎会把灰尘吸进来。

sentences.english: Theres nothing quite like watching a fleet of enemies battlecruisers circle the drain!
sentences.chinese: 没有比看到一整群大和舰被吸进黑洞里更爽的了。

sentences.english: It's good for you to suck in fresh shore air.
sentences.chinese: 吸进清新的海滨空气对你有好处。

definition: to breathe in/to suck in/to inhale
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
to draw (towards)/to be drawn to/to be sucked in
to adhere to a surface/to absorb/to draw in/(fig.) to attract/(chemistry) adsorption
to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way
